did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: L. Dow and Annie Hess/Israel Warner Deed 1875
did.abstract: This collection consists of one document, a deed transferring land and one half of a line of stone fence, for the sum of $75, in Hamilton, Loudoun County, Virginia from L[orenzo] Dow and Annie Hess to Israel Warner. The document is notarized by Wm. McCray, Justice of the Peace, 7 July 1875. The land transferred was part of the bed of the old County Road leading from Hamilton depot to Beans Mill.
did.origination: Unknown, transferred from Loudoun County Public Library to Town of Leesburg, 1994.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Physical characteristics and conditions affect use of this material. Photocopying not permitted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: L. Dow and Annie Hess/Israel Warner Deed, 1875 (SC0100) Thomas Balch Library, Leesburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Unknown, transferred from Loudoun County Public Library to Town of Leesburg, 1994.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Israel Warner (1796-1887), a son of George Warner, Sr. (ca. 1760-1847) and Sarah Schumachern (Shoemaker) (1764-1831) resided in Loudoun County and owned and operated Pleasant View Farm.

L[orenzo] Dow Hess and Annie R. McFarland, a widow, were married 15 December 1869 in Loudoun County. L. Dow Hess (ca. 1828-1893) and Annie R. McFarland Hess (ca. 1849-1915) are buried in Lakeview Cemetery, Hamilton, Loudoun County, Virginia.

William McCray (1818-1894) was a farmer in Hamilton, Loudoun County, Virginia. He married Elizabeth Hatcher (1814-1890), a widow, in 1846. William and Elizabeth McCray are buried in the Goose Creek Burying Ground, Lincoln, Loudoun County, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one document, a deed transferring land and one half of a line of stone fence, for the sum of $75, in Hamilton, Loudoun County, Virginia from L[orenzo] Dow and Annie Hess to Israel Warner. The document is notarized by Wm. McCray, Justice of the Peace, 7 July 1875. The land transferred was part of the bed of the old County Road leading from Hamilton depot to Beans Mill.
